page.title: 18ORCHARDS IN THE TOAT AREA
page.content: South of the Toat Monument lies Tullens Toat, an apple orchard of some 130 acres. This is one of four orchards in this area, the others being smaller, between 15 and 25 acres each. Most of the trees are the original Cox's Orange Pippin variety. In 1985 the owner of Tullens Toat was awarded the Elgar Memorial Bowl for the outstanding orchard in the South of England. The apples are sold either direct to the public or marketed through a cooperative fruit society. Strawberries and raspberries are also grown. Tullens Toat operate pick your own sales but the smaller Poplar Fruit Farm specialises in early and late crops and supplies direct to a famous London store. The owner of Poplar is proud that he owns his 15 acres whereas his father and grandfather were farm employees.
